ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a lot about writing and reading.
Through this course, I was able to strengthen my writing skills significantly.
I think I got much better at literary analysis and the related skill of writing essays doing that. (Much better). I would say that is the main skill I took out of the course.
How to analyze literature effectively and construct my own academic arguments surrounding it.
I learned how to write a well constructed essay
I was able to advance my writing and literary analysis skills. I also realize that I enjoy literary discussion.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
I think the class discussions were a strength. Professor Tu is brilliant, and taught very effectively. Feedback on essays was really, really solid. 

Some of the readings could have been better, that's really the only flaw.

Strengths: Very engaging and enjoyable 
Weaknesses: None
Strengths: you get really really detailed feedback on papers, which really is helpful for the learning process. Class is also a lot of fun and engaging.
A strength is the wide freedom in the topics we could write about. The essays were a highlight of the class for me, so I think that is one of the classes strengths.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would absolutely reccomend this class to other people interested in writing.
I have already recommmened this course to a few of my peers simply because of how much I've enjoyed it. Its rare to come across a course that not only challenges you, but is also enjoyable.

I would recommend this course. If you have an English credit need or just want to take a lit seminar, this is a great option. I am not an English person and greatly enjoyed the types of analysis we did in class. So yes, I would suggest taking it.
Absolutely. Professor was really nice and encouraging of all ideas related to a work. The readings were great too and were honestly something I enjoyed doing
Yes! The readings and discussions were all very interesting.
Yes, I though it was a great course; the perfect mix of fun and knowledge.
